org.codehaus.groovy.grails.plugins.quartz
Interface GrailsTaskClass

All Superinterfaces:
org.codehaus.groovy.grails.commons.GrailsClass, org.codehaus.groovy.grails.commons.InjectableGrailsClass
All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultGrailsTaskClass
public interface GrailsTaskClass
extends org.codehaus.groovy.grails.commons.InjectableGrailsClass

Represents a task class in Grails.

Since:
0.1
Author:
Micha?? K??ujszo, Graeme Rocher, Marcel Overdijk, Sergey Nebolsin (nebolsin@gmail.com)

          Get cron expression used for configuring scheduler.

          If task is durable returns true.

long getTimeout()
Get task timeout between executions.

Returns:
timeout between job executions (repeat interval) in milliseconds

long getStartDelay()
Get start delay before first execution after starting scheduler.

Returns:
delay between job's registering and first execution in milliseconds

getRepeatCount

int getRepeatCount()
Get the number of times the job should repeat, after which it will be automatically deleted

Returns:
maximum job's executions count

getCronExpression

String getCronExpression()
Get cron expression used for configuring scheduler.

Returns:
cron expression configured for this job

getGroup

String getGroup()
Get group name used for configuring scheduler.

Returns:
jobs group name for this job

isCronExpressionConfigured

boolean isCronExpressionConfigured()
If cronExpression property is set returns true.

Returns:
true, if cron expression is configured for this job, false overwise

isConcurrent

boolean isConcurrent()
If jobs can be executed concurrently returns true.

Returns:
true if several instances of this job can run concurrently

isSessionRequired

boolean isSessionRequired()
If task requires Hibernate Session bounded to thread returns true.

Returns:
true if this job require a Hibernate Session bounded to thread

getVolatility

boolean getVolatility()
If task is volatile (will not be persisted between Quartz runs) returns true.

Returns:
true if this job is volatile

getDurability

boolean getDurability()
If task is durable returns true.

Returns:
true if this job is durable
